1.text: A covenant I made for mine eyes, And what—do I attend to a virgin?

2.text: And what is the portion of God from above? And the inheritance of the Mighty from the heights?

3.text: Is not calamity to the perverse? And strangeness to workers of iniquity?

4.text: Doth not He see my ways, And all my steps number?

5.text: If I have walked with vanity, And my foot doth hasten to deceit,

6.text: He doth weigh me in righteous balances, And God doth know my integrity.

7.text: If my step doth turn aside from the way, And after mine eyes hath my heart gone, And to my hands cleaved hath blemish,

8.text: Let me sow—and another eat, And my products let be rooted out.

9.text: If my heart hath been enticed by woman, And by the opening of my neighbour I laid wait,

10.text: Grind to another let my wife, And over her let others bend.

11.text: For it is a wicked thing, and a judicial iniquity;

12.text: For a fire it is, to destruction it consumeth, And among all mine increase doth take root,

13.text: If I despise the cause of my man-servant, And of my handmaid, In their contending with me,

14.text: Then what do I do when God ariseth? And when He doth inspect, What do I answer Him?

15.text: Did not He that made me in the womb make him? Yea, prepare us in the womb doth One.

16.text: If I withhold from pleasure the poor, And the eyes of the widow do consume,

17.text: And I do eat my morsel by myself, And the orphan hath not eat of it,

18.text: (But from my youth He grew up with me as with a father, And from the belly of my mother I am led.)

19.text: If I see any perishing without clothing, And there is no covering to the needy,

20.text: If his loins have not blessed me, And from the fleece of my sheep He doth not warm himself,

21.text: If I have waved at the fatherless my hand, When I see in him the gate of my court,

22.text: My shoulder from its blade let fall, And mine arm from the bone be broken.

23.text: For a dread unto me is calamity from God, And because of His excellency I am not able.

24.text: If I have made gold my confidence, And to the pure gold have said, ‘My trust,’

25.text: If I rejoice because great is my wealth, And because abundance hath my hand found,

26.text: If I see the light when it shineth, And the precious moon walking,

27.text: And my heart is enticed in secret, And my hand doth kiss my mouth,

28.text: It also is a judicial iniquity, For I had lied to God above.

29.text: If I rejoice at the ruin of my hater, And stirred up myself when evil found him,

30.text: Yea, I have not suffered my mouth to sin, To ask with an oath his life.

31.text: If not—say ye, O men of my tent, ‘O that we had of his flesh, we are not satisfied.’

32.text: In the street doth not lodge a stranger, My doors to the traveller I open.

33.text: If I have covered as Adam my transgressions, To hide in my bosom mine iniquity,

34.text: Because I fear a great multitude, And the contempt of families doth affright me, Then I am silent, I go not out of the opening.

35.text: Who giveth to me a hearing? lo, my mark. The Mighty One doth answer me, And a bill hath mine adversary written.

36.text: If not—on my shoulder I take it up, I bind it a crown on myself.

37.text: The number of my steps I tell Him, As a leader I approach Him.

38.text: If against me my land doth cry out, And together its furrows weep,

39.text: If its strength I consumed without money, And the life of its possessors, I have caused to breathe out,

40.text: Instead of wheat let a thorn go forth, And instead of barley a useless weed! The words of Job are finished.
